page.title: 08Employment, Faceby
page.content: {Self-employed}persons in the area are chiefly farmers, most of whom have family as work force and employ casual seasonal labour.{Local employment}is from farms, potato merchant, landscape gardener and riding stables. Poultry- rearing units in Faceby closed recently with a loss of 14 jobs; of their disused buildings designated for light industry, one is occupied by a woodworker making settee frames, and another has planning approval for auto-repair work.{Commuters,}mainly to Teesside, include garage owners, architect, accountant, chemist, baker, builder,plant hirer,shopfitter,painter and decorator, and industrial workers. In many families both partners have whole or part-time jobs. For{school- {leavers}there is nothing locally though a riding stable gives holiday and weekend work for a few youngsters.
